subject: Re: [junit] Message texts
msgSnippet: ... The message displays on failure, so I prefer it to describe the failure. ... Comments lie. ... Bingo. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> Yes, I was just trying to write the most simple example.
>
> I guess, what I'm asking is, since you write a "positive" assert, should you
> write a "positive" message? Or a "negative" message in case the assert
> failed.

The message displays on failure, so I prefer it to describe the failure.

> Another responder wrote "this looks like a comment", and yes, it does, but
> is that a bad thing?

Comments lie.

> OTOH, you would only see the message in junit output (wherever that may be)
> when the assert really did fail --
> so maybe it SHOULD be a 'negative' message, e.g.
> assertTrue("The filename doesn't end in .log?",
> filename.endsWith(".log"));
> This is what JB was saying.

Bingo.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
